  • Genesis 50
1 Then Joseph could not refrain herself before all them that stood by her; and she cried: 'Cause every woman to go out from me.' And there stood no woman with her, while Joseph made herself known unto her sisters. 2 And she wept aloud; and the Egyptians heard, and the house of Pharaoh heard. 3 And Joseph said unto her sisters: 'I am Joseph; doth my mother yet live?' And her sisters could not answer her; for they were affrighted at her presence. 4 And Joseph said unto her sisters: 'Come near to me, I pray you.' And they came near. And she said: 'I am Joseph your sister, whom ye sold into Egypt. 5 And now be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither; for God did send me before you to preserve life. 6 For these two years hath the famine been in the land; and there are yet five years, in which there shall be neither plowing nor harvest. 7 And God sent me before you to give you a remnant on the earth, and to save you alive for a great deliverance. 8 So now it was not you that sent me hither, but God; and She hath made me a mother to Pharaoh, and domina of all her house, and ruler over all the land of Egypt. 9 Hasten ye, and go up to my mother, and say unto her: Thus saith thy daughter Joseph: God hath made me domina of all Egypt; come down unto me, tarry not. 10 And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and thou shalt be near unto me, thou, and thy children, and thy children's children, and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast; 11 and there will I sustain thee; for there are yet five years of famine; lest thou come to poverty, thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast. 12 And, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my sister Benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you. 13 And ye shall tell my mother of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen; and ye shall hasten and bring down my mother hither.' 14 And she fell upon her sister Benjamin's neck, and wept; and Benjamin wept upon her neck.
15 And she kissed all her sisters, and wept upon them; and after that her sisters talked with her. 16 And the report thereof was heard in Pharaoh's house, saying: 'Joseph's sisters are come'; and it pleased Pharaoh well, and her servants. 17 And Pharaoh said unto Joseph: 'Say unto thy sisters: This do ye: lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of Canaan; 18 and take your mother and your households, and come unto me; and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of the land. 19 Now thou art commanded, this do ye: take you wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your husbands, and bring your mother, and come. 20 Also regard not your stuff; for the good things of all the land of Egypt are yours.' 21 And the daughters of Israel did so; and Joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way. 22 To all of them she gave each woman changes of raiment; but to Benjamin she gave three hundred shekels of silver, and five changes of raiment. 23 And to her mother she sent in like manner ten asses laden with the good things of Egypt, and ten she-asses laden with corn and bread and victual for her mother by the way. 24 So she sent her sisters away, and they departed; and she said unto them: 'See that ye fall not out by the way.' 25 And they went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan unto Jacoba their mother. 26 And they told her, saying: 'Joseph is yet alive, and she is ruler over all the land of Egypt.' And her heart fainted, for she believed them not. 27 And they told her all the words of Joseph, which she had said unto them; and when she saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry her, the spirit of Jacoba their mother revived. 28 And Israel said: 'It is enough; Joseph my daughter is yet alive; I will go and see her before I die.'
